```{python}

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pygwalker as pyg
import time 

# filtering about age younger and older
# create a new column dataframe to multiply "Annual Income" * "Spending Score (1-100)"
# filter only male another female with function input/output to choose 'male/female'
# load dashboard
# 

df = pd.read_csv('data/Mall_Customers.csv')
df.head()

df.columns

young_older = df[(df['Age'] < 18) | (df['Age'] > 60)]
young_older.tail(100)


df['Total'] = df['Annual Income (k$)'] + df['Spending Score (1-100)']
df.head()

def genre():
    while True:
        choose = str(input("What genre do you want to Choose?\n1- Male\n2- Female\n3- Leave\nChoose: ")).title()
        if(choose == 'Male'):
            male = df[df['Genre'] == 'Male']
            print(male.to_string())
            # male.head()
            break
        elif(choose == 'Female'):
             female = df[df['Genre'] == 'Female']
             print(female.to_string())
             # female.head()
             break
        elif(choose == "Leave"):
            print("You Leave")
            break
        else:
            print("Incorrect, Try again!\n")

genre()

time.sleep(1)
print("Plot 1")


# plot distribuition by genre (male/female)
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
sns.countplot(data=df, x='Genre', palette='Set2')
plt.title("Distribuition of Customer")
plt.xlabel("Gender")
plt.ylabel("Count")
plt.savefig('Distribuition_Customer.png')
plt.show()

time.sleep(1)
print("Plot 2")

# age distribuition
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
sns.histplot(data=df, x='Age', bins=20, kde=True, color="steelblue")
plt.title("Age Distribuition of Customers")
plt.xlabel("Age")
plt.ylabel("Frequency")
plt.savefig('Age_Distribuition.png')
plt.show()

time.sleep(1)
print("Plot 3")

# income vs spending score
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
sns.scatterplot(data=df, x='Annual Income (k$)', y='Spending Score (1-100)',
                hue='Genre', s=100, alpha=0.6)

plt.title("Income vs Spending Score by Gender")
plt.xlabel("Annual Income (k$)")
plt.ylabel("Spending Score (1-100)")
plt.savefig('Score_Gender.png')
plt.show()







```
